summary: This bill, the Accreditation Choice and Innovation Act, amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to reform accreditation processes. It introduces changes regarding accrediting agency recognition criteria, including state-designated agencies, Secretarial requirements, operational procedures, and public availability of information. The bill also addresses religious institutions, independent evaluations, and risk-based review processes while defining key terms like "program length," "program of study," and "religious mission." Finally, it modifies the National Advisory Committee on Institutional Quality and Integrity (NACIQI).
